Learn More & Join Download Assignment PDF Before You Shoot â€¢ Identify a personal story or theme you wish to convey in your photographs. â€¢ Scout locations that resonate with the narrative you want to portray. â€¢ Gather props or elements that can enhance the story you're telling. â€¢ Plan your shot list to include different angles and compositions that support the narrative. â€¢ Set your camera to either aperture priority or shutter priority mode with ISO fixed at 200. The Assignment Technical Focus â€¢ Use aperture priority mode at f/4 with ISO 200 fixed, allowing the camera to adjust shutter speed for depth of field control. â€¢ Experiment with different focal lengths to capture varied perspectives of the same subject. â€¢ Focus on balancing light and shadow to create mood and atmosphere in your images. â€¢ Utilize leading lines in your composition to guide the viewer's eye through the story. â€¢ Incorporate depth in your images by including foreground, middle ground, and background elements. Creative Focus â€¢ Look for candid moments that reveal emotions and relationships between subjects. â€¢ Use color and contrast to enhance the emotional tone of your photographs. â€¢ Experiment with negative space to emphasize your subject and the story it tells. â€¢ Capture gestures and body language that convey interaction and connection. â€¢ Try to tell a story in a single frame by focusing on a decisive moment. Assignment Tasks â€¢ Photograph a series of portraits that express different emotions, using aperture priority mode at f/2.8 with ISO 200 fixed. â€¢ Create a photo essay that follows a day in the life of a local community member, using shutter priority mode at 1/250s with ISO 200 fixed. â€¢ Capture a moment of interaction between two people, focusing on their gestures and expressions while in aperture priority mode at f/5.6 with ISO 200 fixed. â€¢ Shoot an environmental portrait that tells a story about the subject's life through the use of props and background elements, using aperture priority mode at f/4 with ISO 200 fixed. â€¢ Document an event or gathering, capturing candid moments that convey the atmosphere, using shutter priority mode at 1/125s with ISO 200 fixed. â€¢ Create a series of images that depict a specific theme or concept, ensuring each photo contributes to the overall narrative, using aperture priority mode at f/3.5 with ISO 200 fixed. ðŸ’¡ Stretch Tasks â€¢ Develop a multimedia storytelling project that incorporates both photography and audio or written elements. â€¢ Create a photo series that captures a narrative arc, with a clear beginning, middle, and end.
